I thought that's what we've been talking since the beginning...<br =
/><br />On Mar 20, 2009 12:11pm, Stefan Tilkov <stefan.tilkov@...&=
gt; wrote:<br />> On 20.03.2009, at 12:28, Eric J. Bowman wrote:<br />&g=
t; <br />> >> If you find yourself in need of a batch operation, t=
hen most likely> you just haven=92t defined enough resources.>=A0True=
 enough. A collection resource can be created which contains onlymembers 2,=
 5 and 9 and treats DELETE as a stored procedure to delete allmembers along=
 with the collection resource itself. No problem. But,hypothetically, why? =
I still see no compelling reason to optimizeDELETE at the expense of the vi=
sibility which allows proper cachebehavior.<br />> <br />> Atomicity?=
<br />> <br />> <br />> Stefan<br />> <br />>
--001636c5a53718a90404658bdd51--
